How to Resize Images

Step 1: Upload your image by clicking "browse" or dragging and dropping the file.

Step 2: Choose a resize method - use preset sizes, enter custom dimensions, or scale by percentage.

Step 3: Optionally change the output format (JPG, PNG, or WEBP).

Step 4: Click "Resize Image" and download your resized image.

Common Image Resize Use Cases

Social Media: Different platforms require specific image dimensions. Use our preset sizes or enter custom dimensions for Instagram (1080x1080), Facebook (1200x630), Twitter (1200x675), and LinkedIn (1200x627).

Website Optimization: Resize large images to appropriate dimensions before uploading to your website. This improves page load speed and SEO performance.

Email Attachments: Reduce image dimensions to shrink file size for email attachments.

Thumbnails: Create smaller preview images for galleries and product catalogs.

Frequently Asked Questions About Image Resizing

What happens to image quality when I resize?

When downsizing (making images smaller), quality is generally preserved well. When upsizing (making images larger), some quality loss or pixelation may occur. For best results, always resize down from a high-resolution source image.

What does "maintain aspect ratio" mean?

Aspect ratio is the proportional relationship between width and height. When enabled, changing one dimension automatically adjusts the other to keep the image from appearing stretched or squished.

Is my image uploaded to your server?

No! This image resizer works entirely in your web browser using HTML5 Canvas technology. Your images are processed locally on your device and never uploaded anywhere.
